pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.12_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.13_0: “Monks, approval is required for a trainee nun to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.14_0: And the designation should be given like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.15_0: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that trainee nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.16_0: ‘Venerables, I, so-and-so, am a trainee nun under Venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.17_0: I ask the Sangha for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.18_0: And they should ask a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.19_0: And they should ask a third time.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.20_0: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.21_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.22_0: She asks the Sangha for approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.23_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.25_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.26_0: She asks the Sangha for approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.27_0: The Sangha gives approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.28_0: Any nun who approves of giving approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.29_0: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.2_0: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to trainee nuns who had not trained for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.30_0: The Sangha has given approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.31_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.32_0: That trainee nun should then be told to say this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.33_0: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.34_0: I undertake to abstain from stealing for two years without transgression.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.35_0: I undertake to abstain from sexual activity for two years without transgression.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.36_0: I undertake to abstain from lying for two years without transgression.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.37_0: I undertake to abstain from alcohol, which causes heedlessness, for two years without transgression.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.38_0: I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.39_0: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.3_0: They were ignorant and incompetent, and did not know what was allowable and what was not.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.40_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.41.1_0: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has not trained in the six rules for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.4_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.5_0: “How can nuns give the full admission to trainee nuns who haven’t trained for two years in the six rules?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.11_0: If, intending to give full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastic boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.12_0: for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.13_0: and the last announcement is made by two announcements.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.14_0: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.15_0: while the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc63:2.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
